aberdeen.title: Aberdeen - Aymane Tajani
aberdeen.projectTitle: Design & Development of a Mobile Solution for Pharmaceutical Sales Order Management Connected to Sage X3.
aberdeen.overviewText: The pharmaceutical sector is a highly regulated and competitive field that relies on the performance of medical representatives to promote and sell products. Traditional order-taking methods, often manual or outdated, lead to errors, delays, and a lack of visibility.Digital transformation is essential to optimize order management and inventory synchronization. In this context, a mobile application connected to Sage X3 via a REST web service has been developed. It allows medical representatives to manage their clients, view inventory in real time, place secure orders, and track their progress.
aberdeen.techDiagram: Technologies and tools used in the Aberdeen project
aberdeen.resp1: Analysis of pharmaceutical sector business needs and definition of functional specifications
aberdeen.resp2: Development of REST web services with Sage X3 in 4GL language for ERP integration
aberdeen.resp3: Design and development of cross-platform mobile application with Flutter/Dart
aberdeen.resp4: Implementation of real-time synchronization between mobile application and Sage X3
aberdeen.resp5: Development of client management features, product catalog and orders
aberdeen.resp6: Configuration and optimization of SQL Server database for performance
aberdeen.resp7: Unit and integration testing with Postman to validate REST APIs
aberdeen.resp8: Implementation of versioning and collaboration with GitHub

ach2.title: REST API
ach2.text: Integration with Sage X3 through REST Web Services (EAI)

aberdeen.archDiagram: Distributed REST architecture of the PharmaX3 application
aberdeen.archText1: The infrastructure is based on a lightweight distributed architecture, enabling direct and secure communication between the mobile application and Sage X3. It consists of the following elements:
aberdeen.archItem1: Mobile Application (Frontend): Developed with Flutter (Dart), this application is installed on medical representatives' tablets. It interacts directly with REST Web Services exposed by Sage X3 via HTTP requests.
aberdeen.archItem2: Sage X3 REST Web Services: Services are configured from representations associated with business classes (orders, clients, inventory). Each call follows these standards: HTTP Basic Auth authentication through username and password, and JSON data exchange
aberdeen.archItem3: Database (SQL Server): All management data (clients, items, orders, inventory) is centralized in the database integrated with Sage X3.
aberdeen.archText2: Note: This model ensures basic security through Sage X3 user credentials and guarantees structured data exchange in JSON, compliant with REST standards.
aberdeen.stat1: Reduction in order time and errors
aberdeen.gallery3: Main features of the PharmaX3 application
aberdeen.gallery6: Interface for item stock status consultation
aberdeen.gallery7: Dashboard interface for order status tracking
aberdeen.gallery8: Interfaces to verify X3 Server connection status

umnia.title: Umnia Bank - Aymane Tajani
umnia.projectTitle: Design & Implementation of a Web Application for Declaring and Managing CCG Flows.
umnia.overviewText: In a context of growing digitalization in Morocco, the manual management of file exchanges between Umnia Bank and the Central Guarantee Fund (CCG) proves to be slow, complex and error-prone. To optimize these processes and ensure compliance, a dedicated application is developed to fully automate the file flow, from initial entry to sending validated files to the CCG. Based on ASP.NET Web API for the backend and ASP.NET MVC with Entity Framework Core Code First for the frontend, this modular and scalable solution ensures reliable management, reduces workload and strengthens the efficiency of the bank's risk department.
umnia.techDiagram: Technologies and tools used in the Umnia Bank project
umnia.resp1: Analysis of banking business needs and definition of functional specifications
umnia.resp2: Development of Web Services for file processing and data management
umnia.resp4: Backend integration with ASP.NET Web API with the frontend
umnia.resp5: Testing and performance optimization of the web application

ach1.title: Web Application
ach1.text: Full stack web application with ASP.NET

ach3.title: Service-oriented architecture
ach3.text: Decomposition of the application into reusable services.

umnia.archDiagram: Technical architecture of the evaluation management application
umnia.archText: The Flux-CCG application is based on an N-tier structure with separation between frontend (ASP.NET MVC) and backend (ASP.NET Web API). CSV and TXT files are exchanged and processed through backend services, while data is transmitted in JSON via HTTP requests from the frontend.

dataclear.title: Dataclear - Aymane Tajani
dataclear.projectTitle: Symfony Development of an MVC Generator for SaaS Applications
dataclear.overview: In a context where the digitalization of Moroccan businesses is accelerating, the Genio project aims to optimize the creation of MVC management applications using a SaaS generator. This generator, based on Symfony 5.4, allows for the rapid production of flexible and customized applications, with an architecture based on three databases: for configuration, for the overall SaaS application, and for each client company.Genio thus facilitates the automatic generation of adapted interfaces, reduces development time, and offers a solution accessible over private or public networks, meeting the growing needs for enterprise application management and maintenance.
dataclear.toolsCaption: Technologies and tools used in the Dataclear project
dataclear.resp1: Development of automatic MVC generator with Symfony for creating SaaS applications
dataclear.resp2: Creation of reusable Symfony templates for different types of management applications
dataclear.resp3: Customization and adaptation of generated applications according to specific client needs
dataclear.resp4: Performance optimization of the generator and produced applications
dataclear.resp5: Complete technical documentation of the generation system and user guide

ach1.title: Automatic Generator
ach1.desc: Creation of a complete and automated MVC generation tool

ach2.title: Client Application
ach2.desc: Customization of an MVC application generated by Genio according to specifications

dataclear.archCaption: Scalable SaaS architecture for applications generated by Genio
dataclear.archDesc: Given the low number of users in the initial version, the infrastructure is limited to a single server to host the generator. However, our objective is to describe the target architecture, designed to host the generated application in SaaS mode. In this context, multiple users will be able to interact with the application simultaneously. To guarantee performance and availability, we implement: A Load Balancer, to intelligently distribute the load between multiple application servers hosted on the front end. Scalable clusters dedicated to storing media downloaded by customers, ensuring dynamic scalability and real-time protection against data loss. This architecture guarantees resilience, scalability, and high availability to provide a smooth experience, even under high demand.
dataclear.img1: Authentication interface of the Genio application
dataclear.img4: List of applications generated by the Genio system

chronotrace.title: Chronotrace - Aymane Tajani
chronotrace.overview: In a performance-focused professional context, ChronoTrace is an intelligent attendance management application that revolutionizes traditional time tracking. Through the integration of advanced technologies such as AI facial recognition, precise GPS geolocation, and secure QR codes, this cross-platform solution offers a modern and reliable approach to employee monitoring. Developed with Flutter and Firebase, ChronoTrace ensures real-time synchronization, an intuitive interface, and scalable architecture to meet the needs of modern businesses.
chronotrace.toolsCaption: Technologies and tools used in the ChronoTrace project
chronotrace.feature1: Facial recognition with ML Kit for automatic and secure identification
chronotrace.feature2: GPS geolocation system for on-site presence validation
chronotrace.feature3: Dynamic QR codes for quick and contactless check-in
chronotrace.feature4: Complete administrator interface for employee and settings management
chronotrace.feature5: Real-time synchronization with Firebase Cloud Firestore
chronotrace.feature6: Advanced user roles and permissions management
chronotrace.feature7: Admin replacement system for leave or absence coverage

highlight1.title: AI Recognition
highlight1.text: 90% accuracy in facial recognition with ML Kit

highlight2.title: Geolocation
highlight2.text: Automatic validation through precise GPS positioning

highlight3.title: Cross-Platform
highlight3.text: Compatible with iOS and Android using Flutter

chronotrace.architectureCaption: Modern technical architecture of the ChronoTrace application
chronotrace.architectureText:
The technical architecture of the ChronoTrace application relies on a modern, modular structure to ensure flexibility and performance. The architecture is divided into three main layers: Frontend, Services, and Database.

  • Mobile Frontend: This layer corresponds to the user interface, developed with the Flutter framework and the Dart language. It is designed to work on mobile devices and web browsers, providing a seamless, cross-platform user experience. Users interact with the application through this interface to perform actions such as clocking in or managing their data.
  • Services: This layer groups together the backend services required for the application to function properly. Implemented services include:
    - Authentication Service: Based on Firebase Authentication, it enables secure user login management.
  • Time and Attendance Services: These include features such as facial recognition (via ML Kit), geolocation (via Google Maps API), and QR code scanning (Flutter QR Code integration). These services are interconnected to ensure flexible time and attendance options tailored to user needs.
  • Database: Data persistence is ensured by Firebase Firestore, a powerful and scalable NoSQL database. It stores user information, roles, and time and attendance history, while ensuring real-time synchronization with the application.

Note: The arrows in the diagram represent the communication flows between the different layers. The frontend communicates with services via HTTP requests (REST API) or Firebase SDKs, while services interact with the database to perform read and write operations. This organization ensures a modular architecture, where each layer can evolve independently to meet the future needs of the application.
chronotrace.gallery4: QR Code scanner interface for quick check-in
chronotrace.gallery5: GPS geolocation interface for presence validation
chronotrace.gallery7: Complete features in the admin menu bar

overview.title: Project Overview

ratib.title: Ratib - Aymane Tajani
ratib.overview: Ratib is a native mobile application (Android) designed for Moroccan mosques to accompany Muslims in their daily practice. It offers essential features such as prayer times, Quran reading tracking (Hizb), announcement scheduling, and much more, all within a modern interface that respects Islamic traditions.

architecture.title: Technical Architecture
architecture.intro: GymTrace's architecture is based on Flutter with Firebase to ensure a smooth user experience and real-time data synchronization. The application uses a modular architecture with separation of presentation, business logic, and data layers. Firebase Firestore ensures persistence of training data, while Firebase authentication manages user account security. The responsive user interface adapts to different screen sizes for optimal mobile use.

overview.title: Project Overview
overview.text: The E-games application is a web application that allows users to purchase video games online through a modern e-commerce platform dedicated to video game sales developed with Django. This complete solution offers a smooth shopping experience with user management, product catalog, shopping cart, payment system, and advanced administration interface. The objective of this project is to create a user-friendly and intuitive platform offering various features to facilitate the search, selection, and purchase of video games.

features.title: Developed Features
features.catalog: Game catalog with advanced search and filters

architecture.title: Technical Architecture
architecture.text:
The E-games application follows a Model-View-Template (MVT) architecture to ensure a clear separation of responsibilities and promote code maintainability and scalability. Here is a description of each component of the architecture:

Models

Models represent the application's data layer. In the case of the E-games application, the "Game" model is used to store information about the games available for purchase, such as name, price, console, etc. The "User" model is used to manage registered user information, such as first and last name, email address, etc. The "Purchase" model stores the details of each purchase made, such as the user, the game purchased, the price, the date, etc.

Views

Views manage the application logic and define how data is presented to users. In the E-games application, different views are developed, such as the homepage view, the game list view, the game details view, the store availability view, the registration form view, and the purchase confirmation view. Each view retrieves the necessary data from the models, performs the appropriate processing, and returns the results to the templates.

Templates

Templates are responsible for displaying data and the visual presentation of the application. In the E-games application, corresponding templates are developed for each view. For example, there is a template for the home page, another for the game list, another for game details, and so on. Templates use tags and variables to display dynamic data from the views. They also help organize the structure and style of the user interface.

The MVT architecture allows for a clear separation of concerns by isolating the application's business logic, presentation, and data. This approach promotes code reusability, facilitates testing, and improves the overall maintainability of the E-games project.

gymtrace.title: GymTrace - Aymane Tajani
gymtrace.heading: GymTrace - Personal Fitness Activity Tracking Application
gymtrace.overview: GymTrace is a fitness mobile app developed with Flutter, designed to help users track their workouts and progress efficiently. The app allows users to save their workouts, track their progress over time, and view detailed exercise history. With an intuitive and modern interface, GymTrace offers a personalized experience to optimize athletic performance and keep users motivated on their fitness journey.

architecture.intro:
GymTrace's architecture is based on Flutter with Firebase for a native mobile experience and cloud data management:

  • Flutter Frontend: User interface developed with Material Design for a native and fluid mobile experience.
  • Firebase Backend: Uses the Firebase ecosystem for secure authentication and cloud service management.
  • Firestore Database: Cloud Firestore for real-time storage and synchronization of workout data, user profiles, and history.
  • Firebase Authentication: Secure login system with user session management via Firebase Auth.
  • Flutter Navigation: Optimized navigation system with custom AppBar and routing between different pages.
  • Visualization: Implementation of graphs and charts for progress tracking with Data synchronized from Firestore.

quicksoum.title: QuickSoum - Aymane Tajani
quicksoum.overviewText: QuickSoum is an innovative and comprehensive mobile application for managing quotes and invoices. Designed to digitize and automate the process, it allows you to create, manage, and track your quotes and invoices professionally, while maintaining an organized customer database. Thanks to its intuitive interface and advanced features, QuickSoum optimizes the productivity of sales teams and simplifies the daily management of businesses.

onlineshop.title: Online Shop - Aymane Tajani
onlineshop.overviewText: OnlineShop is a modern and intuitive e-commerce web platform developed in C# with ASP.NET MVC, built on an Entity Framework Core Code First architecture. Designed to provide a smooth user experience, the site integrates a complete product catalog, detailed pages allowing direct ordering via WhatsApp, as well as a secure administrator space offering complete article management through CRUD operations. Combining performance, ease of use and task automation, OnlineShop constitutes an effective solution for digitalizing sales and optimizing daily business management.

chatbot.title: AI Chatbot & RAG - Aymane Tajani
chatbot.projectTitle: AI Chatbot & RAG System - Conversational Artificial Intelligence
chatbot.overview: This project presents two sophisticated artificial intelligence applications developed with Python and Streamlit. The first is a RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) system for PDF document analysis, allowing questions to be asked about content with source citations. The second is a configurable EMSI chatbot with support for multiple AI models and adjustable parameters. These applications leverage the latest advances in conversational AI and natural language processing to provide intelligent and contextual interactions.

rag.title: 1. PDF-RAG Application
rag.purpose: Purpose: Advanced PDF question-answering system using RAG
rag.feature4: Ask questions about PDF content with source citations

chatbot.feature1: AI model integration via Ollama (llama3.2, qwen:0.5b)
chatbot.feature2: RAG system with HuggingFace vector embeddings
chatbot.feature3: ChromaDB vector database for semantic search
chatbot.archText1: The project architecture is based on a modular and scalable approach:
chatbot.archItem1: Streamlit Frontend: Interactive and responsive user interface for both applications
chatbot.archItem2: Ollama AI Engine: Local orchestration of llama3.2 and qwen:0.5b models
chatbot.archItem3: RAG Pipeline: LangChain + HuggingFace for document processing and embedding
chatbot.archItem4: Vector Database: ChromaDB for optimized storage and semantic search
chatbot.archItem5: PDF Processing: PyPDF for content extraction and segmentation
chatbot.archItem6: Streaming Engine: Real-time responses with persistent state management
chatbot.archText2: System Configuration: Python 3.12.3 with multi-port local deployment (8501/8502) enabling simultaneous execution of both applications.
